trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crab can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Innate Spellcasting. Cronky's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: {@spell Eldritch Blast} (see "Actions" below)
1/day each: {@spell Expeditious Retreat}, {@spell Misty Step}

action.name: Lightning Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cronky makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its eldritch blast

action.name: Lighning Wave
entries: Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Instinctive Shield
entries: Cronky instinctively caters to the power of his brooch of shielding and protects itself, gaining +5 to his AC untill the start of its next turn. This effect can only be used twice, and regains all of its uses at the end of a long rest.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Cronky moves up to its speed and makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Grab (only if Cronky has at least one free claw)
entries: Cronky picks a large or smaller creature within 15 feet with one of its claws. That creature is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. Escaping requires a Strength saving throw ({@dc 19}).

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The heron doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dryst makes three Dancing Death or Necrotic Jolt attacks. Dryst can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Dancing Death
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 7d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Necrotic Jolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Condemned Duel
entries: Dryst can target a humanoid within 30 feet and impose a duel upon him. Both Dryst and the target are sent to a pocket dimension bordering with the plane of wars, and one of them can only leave when the other is dead. When this happens, the survivor is sent back to the place he was standing before entering this dimension.
Dryst can only use this action once per long rest.

reaction.name: Dance with the Sword
entries: When a melee attack misses Dryst, he can use his reaction to gain an extra Dancing Death attack with his multiattack. This effect can stack up to 4 Dancing Death attacks and resets after one minute of it's first usage.
Once the effect resets, this reaction can't be used until the end of a long rest.

fluff.name: Drow Favored Consort
entries: Nearly every priestess of {@deity Lolth|Drow|MTF}, including the powerful {@creature drow matron mother|MPMM} in this book, takes an attractive drow as consort. Chosen as much for beauty as for magical might, a drow favored consort can hold their own in both conversation and combat. Combining the roles of advisor, protector, and beloved, some favored consorts are content with a supporting role, while more ambitious consorts aspire to be the power behind the throne—or even to claim the throne themselves.

Those favored consorts who prove their cunning gain the ear, and perhaps even the heart, of their priestess and are relied on to provide useful advice. No position of consort is assured for long, though; Lolth's priestesses are notoriously fickle, and a consort must often contend with rivals.

Some favored consorts work behind the scenes to undermine the evils encouraged by Lolth. Others can be found in Underdark cities free of Lolth's influence, where these powerful spellcasters apply their might toward ending her tyranny.

trait.name: Necrotic Smite
entries: When Dryst hits with a Dancing Death attack, he can invoke dark powers to smite its target. The target takes extra {@damage 4d8} damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. Dryst can use this effect 3 times, and recovers all uses after a long rest.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hark casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Hark has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Hark to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Hark has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Master of Illusions
entries: Intelligence checks made to distinguish illusions created from Hark and Intelligence saving throws to resist any of their effects are made with disadvantage

trait.name: Aura of Detection Disruption
entries: Powerful demonic energies weaken and break hostile magical effects of the school of divination in a 240ft radius sphere around Hark, making their effects not work, but not breaking {@status concentration} on them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hark makes 4 Eldrith Blast attacks

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}) force damage. If the target is hit, it's pushed back 10ft away from Hark. If Hark has any illusory double, he can cast this spell from its position instead.

action.name: Chaotic Presence
entries: Hark uses demonic powers to create 5 illusory doubles. He can immidiately cast {@spell invisibility} on himself with this same action.

Among drow followers of {@deity Lolth|Drow|MTF}, each noble house is led by a matron mother, an influential priestess of Lolth charged with carrying out the god's will while also advancing the interests of the family. Matron mothers embody the scheming and treachery associated with the Queen of Spiders. Each stands at the center of a vast conspiratorial web, with demons, spiders, and conscripted soldiers positioned between them and their enemies. Although matron mothers command great power, that power depends on maintaining the Spider Queen's favor, and the goddess sometimes capriciously takes back what she has given. The stat block here represents a matron mother at the height of her power.

A matron mother is almost never encountered alone. She is typically accompanied by a {@creature drow favored consort|MPMM} and a {@creature drow house captain|MPMM}, each of whom appears in this book. Other Underdark creatures might also be in the priestess's presence, providing protection or advice.

entries.name: Mothers of Rebellion
entries: Some matron mothers renounce {@deity Lolth|Drow|MTF} and join the war against their former goddess. Such drow could be of any alignment, and they lose the following abilities in the stat block: Lolth's Fickle Favor, Summon Servant, and Compel Demon. Even without these abilities, drow matron mothers are formidable opponents, and several of them hold positions of great influence in the Underdark armies arrayed against the followers of Lolth.

entries.name: A Matron Mother's Lair
entries: The palace of a drow matron mother is her home and fortress. Sigils throughout the building allow the matron mother to use the following lair actions while within it.

Any temple of {@deity Lolth|Drow|MTF} also functions as a matron mother's lair while she is inside it, unless she has renounced Lolth or another matron mother is present. When two or more matron mothers gather within a temple of their goddess, none of them can use it as their lair.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the drow can take one of the following lair actions when in her lair; she can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Perceive Interlopers
entries: The drow projects her mind throughout her lair, marking any potential threats against her or her retinue. Until initiative count 20 of the next round, hostile creatures within the lair can't become hidden from her and gain no benefit from the {@condition invisible} condition against her.

items.name: Spectral Web
entries: A glistening spectral spider web erupts from a point the drow can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature within 60 feet of that point must succeed a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Telekinetic Throw
entries: The drow targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her and attempts to expel it from her presence. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be flung {@dice 2d6 × 10} feet through the air. A creature smashed into a solid object takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved. If released in midair, the creature takes falling damage as normal.

reaction.name: Illusionary Force Feedback
entries: When one of Hark's illusory doubles is hit and destroyed by an attack, Hark can use his reaction to deal {@damage 6d8} psychic damage to the attacker.

reaction.name: Instinctive Double
entries: When Hark takes damage, he can use his reaction to immediately cast {@spell mislead} and move up to his speed.

legendary.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: Hark uses Eldritch Blast

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 actions)
entries: Hark casts one of his spells.

monster.name: Nature-Abjurant Chimera

trait.name: Spell Turning
entries: The chimera has advantage on a saving throw against any spell that targets only the chimera (not an area). If the chimera's saving throw is successful and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the chimera and instead targets the caster.

trait.name: Unstable Form
entries: At the start of each of its turn, the chimera takes a new form, replacing the previous one. Roll a {@dice d6} and change the appearance based on the following results:
1 - Dragon form: the chimera's fur becomes draconic scales, and its head becomes that of reddish colored dragon. The chimera's AC becomes 20.
2 - Lion form: the chimera's head becomes that of a lion, and its claws grow longer. The chimera's first successful claw attack deals an extra {@damage 3d10} slashing damage.
3 - Snake Form: The chimera's head becomes that of a snake, empowering its bite attack and granting it a tail attack.
4 - Goat Form: The chimera's head becomes that of a goat, granting it a ram attack.
5 - Eagle Form: The chimera's head becomes that of a eagle, giving it advantage on perception checks. In this form, its fly speed is 140ft and has flyby.
6 - Abhorrent Form: The chimera gains 2 forms at the same time.

trait.name: Unnatural Regeneration
entries: The chimera regains 30 hit points at the start of its turn. If the chimera takes thunder or lightning damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the chimera's next turn

trait.name: Nature Forsakenness
entries: If the chimera would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon and Ram attack, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the chimera can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes attacks based on her current form:
Dragon Form: 1 claw attacks and 1 bite attack or 1 breath attack.
Lion Form: 2 claw attacks and 1 bite attack.
Snake Form: 1 venom bite attack and 1 tail attack
Goat Form: 1 claw attack and 1 ram attack
Eagle Form: 1 claw attack and 1 bite attack, or 2 claw attacks and 1 bite attack if flying.
Abhorrent Form: up to 2 bite attacks made with different heads, up to 2 claw attacks and 1 other attack, depending on the other two forms.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Venom Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is hit, it must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 {@damage 4d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition restrained}. If the chimera is already restraining a creature in this way, it has to use tail on the same creature, but the attack automatically hits.

action.name: Ram
entries: The chimera rushes forward in a 20-foot line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, getting pushed back 20ft from the chimera and getting knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 8d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The term chimera applies to a wide variety of disparate monsters that combine the features of multiple beasts. While many artistic depictions represent chimeras as an amalgam of lion, ram, and dragon, these beasts appear with nearly endless variations.

The Akroans tell a tale of the first chimera's origin, wherein the god Keranos sought to test Nylea's favorite champion, Renata of Setessa, by creating a beast so deadly that even she would balk at trying to hunt it. When Renata slayed this lion-ram-dragon creation effortlessly, Keranos created another combination of deadlier beasts to challenge her. She slayed that beast, too. Despite countless attempts, Keranos was unable to create a beast that Renata couldn't best.

Chimeras typically roam the deep wilds of the world, constantly seeking a lair that would perfectly suit one of its heads, but then finding it unsatisfying to two-thirds of its being. As a result, a hungry chimera might appear out of a clear sky to pick off prey nearly anywhere. This threat grows even more significant in regions where magic runs rampant or where portals to the realm of Nyx exist, as unrestrained magical energy often causes more chimeras to appear in a region. As such chaotic magic is inherent to a chimera's being, these monsters often manage to shrug off spells cast against them.

entries.name: Customizing a Chimera
entries: The Theran chimera stat block presents one possible chimera configuration. You may customize these statistics to design your own unique chimera. To do so, simply roll once on one or all of the following tables. Results from the Body Composition table adjust the Theran chimera as described, while results on the Breath Weapons, Head Attacks, and Tail Attacks tables replace those respective actions in the stat block. Theran chimeras always have the Claws action. If the results of multiple tables conflict, chose your preferred result.

rows.name: Plains Creature
entries: The chimera's body is that of a large lowland creature, such as a bull or a bear, and it lacks wings and a flying speed. The chimera is especially resilient, gaining resistance to cold and fire damage.

rows.name: Coast Creature
entries: The chimera's body is that of a coastal or aquatic creature, such as a heron or a shark. The chimera gains a swimming speed equal to its walking speed and can breathe air and water.

rows.name: Mountain Creature
entries: The chimera's body is that of a mountain-dwelling creature, such as a ram or a dragon. The chimera doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

rows.name: Swamp Creature
entries: The chimera's body is that of a swamp creature or a cavern-dweller, such as a giant lizard or spider. The chimera gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed and it can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

rows.name: Bull Horns
entries: If the chimera moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a head attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

rows.name: Shark Bite
entries: The chimera has advantage on a head attack roll against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

rows.name: Unicorn Horn
entries: The chimera's head attack is magical and deals an extra 4 ({@dice 1d8}) radiant damage.

rows.name: Cockatrice Beak
entries: A creature hit by the chimera's head attack must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

rows.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@dice 8d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

rows.name: Tidal Wave Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera has an aquatic creature's head that exhales a torrent of acidic water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@dice 5d10}) acid damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

rows.name: Venom Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera has a venomous creature's head that exhales a spray of poison in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 35 ({@dice 10d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

rows.name: Necrotic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera exhales necrotic energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 31 ({@dice 7d8}) necrotic damage and is unable to regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Venomous Tail
entries: The chimera's tail ends in a snake's head or a stinger, which deals piercing damage instead of bludgeoning damage. In addition, when the chimera hits a creature with its tail, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

rows.name: Perplexing Tail
entries: The chimera has an additional head where its tail should be. The chimera loses its tail attack and makes two head attacks when it takes the Multiattack action. Use the Head Attacks table to determine the nature of the new head.

rows.name: Shark Tail
entries: The chimera's tail is a large fin. When the chimera hits a creature with its tail, the creature is also pushed up to 10 feet away.

rows.name: Constricting Tail
entries: The chimera's tail can constrict prey. If the chimera hits a creature with its tail, the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is Large or smaller. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the chimera can't use its tail on another target.

legendary.name: Flying Rush
entries: The chimera flies up to its flying speed and makes one attack against a creature if any is in range.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: The chimera flaps its wings, creating a strong gust of wind and propelling itself 30ft upwards. Any creature in a 20ft radius sphere centered on the chimera has to make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 20ft away from the chimera and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Abhorrent Cry (Costs 2 actions)
entries: The chimera exhales a thunderous weeping cry. Each other creature in a 300ft radius sphere centered on the chimera must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and its maximum hit points are reduced by the same amount. On a success, the creature takes half damage but its maximum hit points remain the same. Failure or success, the chimera heals an amount of hit points equal to the total damage dealt.

mythic.name: Vorpal Ray (Costs 2 actions)
entries: The chimera fires a deep blue and yellow beam of solid lightning at a creature. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 7d10} lightning damage and {@damage 7d10} necrotic damage. If the damage reduces a creature to 0 or less hit points, the creature dies and its body explodes in ashes, dealing {@damage 5d10} lightning damage to creatures within 15ft. A creature killed this way can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell

mythicHeader: If the chimera's Nature Forsakenness trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the option below as legendary action.

trait.name: Alien Mind
entries: Magic and other features can't determine Schum's creature type. If a creature tries to read Schum's thoughts, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw or have the {@condition stunned} condition for 1 minute. The {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the corrupter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The corrupter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corrupter makes three Whispering Blade attacks and can use Debilitating Touch.

action.name: Whispering Blade
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the spell {@spell confusion} untill the end of their next turn.

action.name: Weakening Touch
entries: The corrupter's squirming tentacle lashes out at a creature the corrupter can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or they deal half damage with weapon attack until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Weakening Touch for 24 hours.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Schum magically transforms into any creature that is Small or Medium, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the corrupter is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker the corrupter can see hits the corrupter with an attack, the corrupter halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary.name: Cunning
entries: Schum escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} conditions on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Schum makes one Whispering Blade attack.

legendary.name: Entropic Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Schum dissolves into a shifting mass of smoke and clutter. Up to two creatures Schum can see within 20 feet of itself must make a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This transformation lasts until the end of Schum's next turn. While transformed, Schum has advantage on attack rolls, attack rolls made against it have disadvantage, and it can move through spaces at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.
A challenge for tier 3 play (levels 11 to 16), the otherworldly corrupter is a horrific Aberration that infects or impersonates a host.

entries.name: The Rogue's Lair
entries: This villain resides in a place of power and safety, whether that's a hidden thieves' guildhall or a lavish manse. The lair is filled with clever defenses to disorient, weaken, and kill intruders.
The villain's challenge rating increases while the villain is in this lair:

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties) while in its lair, the villain can take one of the following lair actions; the villain can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Distraction
items.entry: A shrill sound fills the lair. Creatures that can hear it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

items.name: Snares
items.entry: Hidden snares target up to three creatures the villain can see in the lair. Each creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have the grappled condition (escape DC 15) and the restrained condition until it escapes or the snare holding it is destroyed. Each snare has AC 11, 10 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

items.name: Traps
items.entry: Traps target up to two creatures the villain can see in the lair. Each target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be struck by a trap. The villain rolls a number of d6s equal to its proficiency bonus, and struck targets take damage equal to the total. The damage is bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, fire, or poison, chosen by the villain when the villain uses this action.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a villain's lair is warped by their presence, creating one or more of the following effects:

items.name: Corruption Abounds
items.entry: While within 3 miles of the lair, creatures that aren't members of the villain's organization have disadvantage on ability checks that rely on the Insight, Perception, and Persuasion skills.

items.name: Potent Toxins
items.entry: When members of the villain's organization deal poison damage while within 3 miles of the lair, they ignore the target's resistance to poison damage.

entries: If the villain dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

trait.name: Protection of Spes
entries: While the Herald of Kadjur is attuned to the fragment of Spes, at the end of each of his turns he heals an amount of hit points equal to his maximum hit points and won't die even if reduced to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Dance of Chaos
entries: The Herald of Kadjur projects a 300ft aura around himself. At the start of their turn, any creature within the aura must roll a {@dice d10} and suffer the resulting effect:

1 - The creature is subject to an inversion of characteristics. Its strength, dexterity and constitution become its intelligence, wisdom and charisma respectively. This effect lasts until the start of its next turn.
2-3 - The creature recovers {@dice 2d10} hit points but is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} this way, the creature can't regain hit points.
4-5   - Untill the start of their next turn, the creature's weapon and spell attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d10} force damage, but if they miss the creature takes the damage instead.

6 - 7 - The creature becomes resistant to one random element between fire, cold, thunder, lightning and acid but vulnerable to another random element among the same group. This effect lasts until the start of its next turn.
8 - 9 - The creature is {@condition blinded}, but gains a +3 bonus to Saving Throws until the start of its next turn.
10 - The creature gains the effects of {@spell haste} for this turn. Lethargy takes effects as per the spell description thereafter.

action.name: Chaos Barrage
entries: The Herald of Kajdur projects 3 Chaos Bolt upcast to level 8 to 3 different targets.

action.name: Vorpal Vortex {@recharge}
entries: A 10ft radius whirlwind of tears in the reality emerges in a point within 60ft of the Herald of Kadjur. Any creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity Saving Throw, taking {@damage 7d10} slashing damage on success. On failure, the creatures take {@damage 14d10} slashing damage and suffer an lingerin injury ({@table Lingering Injuries})

reaction.name: Entropic Feedback
entries: When a creature misses the Herald of Kadjur, he can use its reaction to inflict one stack of Entropic Instability.

bonus.name: Entropic Jaunt
entries: The Herald of Kadjur targets a creature afflicted by Entropic Instability. The creature must succeed on a d {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be jaunted at another creature's space within 60ft, taking {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage. The other creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same amount of bludgeoning damage

legendary.name: Chaos Barrage
entries: The Herald of Kadjur attacks with his Chaos Barrage

legendary.name: Elemental Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each enemy of the Herald of Kadjur's choice that he can see must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure they take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage and are {@condition deafened} untill the end of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Axhorbia makes three Sorrowful Claws attacks or two Sorrowful Claws attacks and one Whip of Pain attack

action.name: Sorrowful Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is below half its hit points maximum, the damage is doubled.

action.name: Whip of Pain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage. The target must succeed in a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be shocked by pain until the end of its next turn. While shocked by pain, the target can't take actions, bonus actions or reactions.

action.name: Painful Wailing
entries: Each creature in a 20 feet radius sphere centered on Axhorbia that can hear it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, each target becomes vulnerable to damage untill the end of Axhorbia's next turn. A creature can use it's action to shake itself or another creature out of this effect.

trait.name: Taste of Pain
entries: When another creature within 30 feet takes damage, Axhorbia gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Aura of Despair
entries: Creatures within 10 feet of Axhorbia feel despair fill their minds. They have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to mantain {@status concentration}, and the minimum DC to keep it becomes 12.

reaction.name: Instill Failure
entries: When a creature that Axhorbia can see succeeds in a saving throw or ability check, Axhorbia can use its reaction to make that creature roll again, taking the lowest outcome.

legendary.name: Claws of Sorrow
entries: Axhorbia makes a Claws of Sorrow attack against a creature within range

legendary.name: Memories of Despair (Costs 2 actions)
entries: Each creature within a 15 feet radius sphere must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of their next turn.

monster.name: Flaming Specter
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Burning Incorporeal Movement
entries: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

The specter can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the specter or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. In addition, the specter can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Fiery Claws
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

A specter is the angry, unfettered spirit of a humanoid that has been prevented from passing to the afterlife. Specters no longer possess connections to who or what they were, yet are condemned to walk the world forever. Some are spawned when dark magic or the touch of a wraith rips a soul from a living body.

entries.name: Beyond Redemption
entries: When a ghost's unfinished business is completed, it can rest at last. No such rest or redemption awaits a specter. It is doomed to the Material Plane, its only end the oblivion that comes with the destruction of its soul. Until then, it bears out its lonely life in forlorn places, carrying on forgotten through the ages of the world.

entries.name: Undying Hatred
entries: Living creatures remind the specter that life is beyond its grasp. The mere sight of the living overwhelms a specter with sorrow and wrath, which can be abated only by destroying said life. A specter kills quickly and mercilessly, for only by depriving others of life can it gain the slightest satisfaction. However, no matter how many lives it extinguishes, a specter always succumbs to its hatred and sorrow.

entries.name: Dwellers in Darkness
entries: Sunlight represents a source of life that no specter can ever hope to douse, and it pains them. When night falls, they leave their final resting places in search of living creatures to slay, knowing that few weapons can harm them in return.
At the first light of dawn, they retreat back into the darkness, where they remain until night falls again.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A specter doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spell.name: Chaotic Scream
entries: You unleash the power of chaotic entropy to blast the intellect of up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} psychic damage and must immediately use it's reaction to make a weapon attack against a random target within range. If the creature can't make that attack, it instead gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.
